    • supportedDivinity

      public static java.lang.Boolean supportedDivinity​(int pNum)
      Method that checks if the divinity can be used in a game with a certain number of players
      Parameters:
      pNum - the number of players
      Returns:
      true if the game is played by two or three players

    • getValidCellForBuilding

      public java.util.ArrayList<Position> getValidCellForBuilding​(int workerRow, int workerColumn, java.util.ArrayList<Divinity> divinitiesInGame, Cell[][] gameCells)
      Generates a list of cell where a certain worker can build, according to Zeus' power: he can also build under his worker.
      Overrides:
      getValidCellForBuilding in class Divinity
      Parameters:
      workerRow - the row where the worker is
      workerColumn - the column where the worker is
      divinitiesInGame - the divinities in the game
      gameCells - the actual board state
      Returns:
      a list of cell valid for the building of the worker

    • build

      public GameControllerState build​(int workerRow, int workerColumn, int buildRow, int buildColumn, Model gd) throws NotAdjacentCellException, OccupiedCellException, DomedCellException, MaximumLevelReachedException, DivinityPowerException
      Requests the model to register the build action performed by the player, according according to Zeus' power: he can also build under his worker.
      Overrides:
      build in class Divinity
      Parameters:
      workerRow - the row where the worker is
      workerColumn - the column where the worker is
      buildRow - the row where the player wants to add a level
      buildColumn - the column where the player wants to add a level
      gd - the game status
      Returns:
      the next controller fsm state
      Throws:
      NotAdjacentCellException - if the cell where the player wants to build is not adiacent to the worker's one
      OccupiedCellException - if the destination cell is occupied by another worker
      DomedCellException - is the cell is already domed
      MaximumLevelReachedException - if the cell contains a level 3 building
      DivinityPowerException - if another divinity blocks the increment of the level

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Getter of name

      Returns:
      the divinity's name

      public java.lang.String getDescription()

      Overrides:
      getDescription in class Divinity
      Returns:
      the description of how the divinity's power affects the game
